summary: GitHub Actions CI workflow with 4 parallel jobs (lint, test, build, validate-manifests) triggered on PRs and pushes to main. Includes golangci-lint v2.10.1, envtest integration tests with coverage, Docker build via Buildx with GHA caching, and CRD manifest validation via make verify-manifests. Least-privilege permissions, concurrency groups, and all actions pinned. Reference documentation added at docs/reference/backend/ci-pipeline.md.

tests_checklist.item: All 4 jobs defined: lint, test, build, validate-manifests
go-version-file: go.mod used in all Go jobs (lint, test, validate-manifests)
No needs: dependencies between jobs (parallel execution)
Concurrency group with cancel-in-progress for non-default branch
Permissions set to contents: read at top-level and per-job
All actions pinned to major version tags

code_quality_checklist.item: CI workflow follows standard GitHub Actions patterns
Clean YAML structure with consistent formatting
Step names are descriptive and consistent
Jobs use appropriate separation of concerns
Doc file uses kebab-case naming matching 28 existing files

security_checklist.item: Docker images built but not pushed (no registry credentials needed)
Actions pinned to specific major version tags

architecture_checklist.item: Single workflow file with 4 parallel jobs (not 4 separate workflows)
Reuses existing Makefile targets where appropriate
Go caching via setup-go, Docker caching via GHA cache backend
Concurrency cancels stale PR runs but not main branch runs

dry_yagni_checklist.item: No unnecessary jobs or steps beyond requirements

fail_fast_checklist.item: Lint errors fail the lint job immediately
Test failures fail the test job
Docker build failures fail the build job
Stale manifests fail the validate-manifests job

defensive_checklist.item: envtest K8s version pinned to 1.32.0 matching Makefile ENVTEST_K8S_VERSION
setup-envtest version pinned to release-0.20 matching Makefile ENVTEST_VERSION
Coverage uses atomic mode for race-enabled tests
e2e tests excluded from CI test run (grep -v /e2e)

suggested_improvements: D2: docs/reference/backend/ci-pipeline.md:45 — Concurrency section shows simplified `cancel-in-progress: true` with comment, while actual workflow uses conditional expression `${{ github.ref != format('refs/heads/{0}', github.event.repository.default_branch) }}`. Consider showing the actual expression for developers debugging CI behavior.

PF1: .github/workflows/ci.yml:99 — VERSION build arg uses `github.sha` instead of `git describe --tags --always --dirty` as specified in plan task 1.3. Since fetch-depth: 0 is already set, a `git describe` step could produce more meaningful version strings once tags exist. Current approach is functional but diverges from Makefile convention.
